venue.name: Blackstone River Valley Bikeway @ The Blackstone River State Park

item.description:
The Blackstone River Bikepath is a really pretty ride; going along the Blackstone River, there are a few waterfalls to see.  For the most part is a flat easier ride, with only a few hills.  It is about 10 miles each way, and I'm planning on doing the whole thing at a slow/moderate pace.... my first time out this year.

The best part about this bike path... bathrooms!!!  And even a DD up a long hill if we chose to stop there on the way back. 

I'll send my cell phone number to "yes" RSVPs the day before. There are multiple parking lots, so please be sure you know which one we are meeting at, and feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

 Hope you can make it!

For information about the bikepath and directions, check out the website: http://www.nps.gov/blac/planyourvisit/blackstone-river-bikeway-the-rhode-island-section.htm

 This is a cross post event w/ Boston Providence Single Parents Group
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the first parking lot on the right with a gold Subaru Tribeca... oh yeah, and a bike!
item.why: “Winter is almost over, the snow is just about all gone, time to break out the bikes and pedal!”

group.name: South Shore Hike, Bike & Social Club

item.name: Biking on the Blackstone River Bikepath (adults and quick kids w/ stamina:)
